questions.text: The 1973 Constitution of Pakistan is based on:
questions.explanation: The 1973 Constitution established a Parliamentary system of government in Pakistan.

questions.text: Article 1 of the Constitution declares Pakistan as:
questions.explanation: Article 1 declares Pakistan as the Islamic Republic of Pakistan.

questions.text: The total number of articles in the 1973 Constitution is:
questions.explanation: The 1973 Constitution originally had 280 articles (now modified through amendments).

questions.text: The term of the National Assembly is:
questions.explanation: The National Assembly has a term of 5 years unless dissolved earlier.

questions.text: According to the Constitution, the President must be a:
questions.explanation: Article 41 requires the President to be a Muslim of at least 45 years of age.

questions.text: Which constitutional amendment changed the name of NWFP to Khyber Pakhtunkhwa?
questions.explanation: The 18th Amendment (2010) changed NWFP to Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.

questions.text: The Fundamental Rights are given in which Part of the Constitution?
questions.explanation: Part II of the Constitution contains the Fundamental Rights and Principles of Policy.

questions.text: The Chief Election Commissioner is appointed by:
questions.explanation: The President appoints the Chief Election Commissioner in consultation with the PM and Opposition Leader.

questions.text: Money bills can only be introduced in:
questions.explanation: Money bills can only be introduced in the National Assembly, not in the Senate.

questions.text: The 25th Amendment to the Constitution dealt with:
questions.explanation: The 25th Amendment (2018) merged FATA into Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.
